vclaim: Domino's pizza gives everyone who participates in Facebook "Copone is good for two big pizza."
date: stated on August 22, 2019 in a Facebook post:
title: No, domino doesn't give coupons to two big pizzas if you're participating in this article.
text: Reporters are known to have put a lot of pizza in the newsrooms, so we're here at Polity Fuckett to tell you that this promising Facebook article for free chips is a pie in the sky. "Dominus now 50!" :: Read Facebook August 22 on an account called "Dominus," the pizza Domino manuscript. "To celebrate we're giving each arrow by 7 today a good coupon for two pizza! - Dominus. This article, in which more than 2,100 people participated during the day, was referred to as part of Facebook's efforts to combat false news and misinformation. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) We've dismantled similar frauds before. In 2018, for example, we found a scan to get Delta tickets free of charge that was fake. The same applies to an online offer to buy donuts free of charge. On January 10, 2021, in an article on Facebook, he said that Nancy Belusi had sent a letter to the Mayor of Portland after demonstrations there "to demand that he stick to the proven democratic playbook." The Dominus account on Facebook that published the free pizza promise was created today. The Facebook account of real Domino pizza was created in January 10, 2008. Nor is the company 50 years old. "We're almost 60!" The spokesman for Domino Jenny Forker told me in an e-mail. We're assessing this wrong Facebook post.
